content: You will next receive a multiple-choice question, each with five options: A, B, C, D, and E respectively. Please provide your answer as a single letter option (your response should contain only one letter as the answer).(For each problem, you need to first present three related but not identical problems, along with a description of each problem and its solution. Finally, provide the answer to the original problem in the form of "Therefore, the final answer is: ".)

Question: His house was a mess, he began doing housework to get what?
Options: A. boredom B. nice home C. michigan D. feeling satisfied E. house clean

A house that is dirty and messy is unpleasant to live in. To make it more comfortable, one must do housework. Doing housework can make the house clean and tidy, and it can also make people feel satisfied. Doing housework can also help develop good living habits and cultivate a sense of responsibility. Doing housework can also help us better understand our parents, and enhance the relationship between us and our parents. Doing housework can also help us learn to take on responsibilities. Doing housework can also help us learn to be independent. Doing housework can also help us learn to be thrifty. Doing housework can also help us learn to be considerate. Doing housework can also help us learn to be patient. Doing housework can also help us learn to be meticulous. Doing housework can also help us learn to be responsible. Doing housework can also help us learn to be persistent. Doing housework can also help us learn to be brave. Doing housework can also help us learn to be confident. Doing housework can also help us learn to be optimistic. Doing housework can also help us learn to be cheerful. Doing housework can also help us learn to be kind. Doing housework can also help us learn to be wise. Doing housework can also help us learn to be smart. Doing housework can also help us learn to be strong.
